name: AppProvider
description:
Sets up the Polaris `AppProvider` and injects the App Bridge script.

This component extends the [`AppProvider`](https://polaris.shopify.com/components/utilities/app-provider) component from Polaris, and accepts all of its props except for `linkComponent`, which is overridden to use the Remix `Link` component.

AppProviderProps.name: AppProviderProps

members.name: i18n
members.description: A locale object or array of locale objects that overrides default translations. If specifying an array then your primary language dictionary should come first, followed by your fallback language dictionaries

members.name: linkComponent
members.description: A custom component to use for all links used by Polaris components

members.name: features
members.description: For toggling features

members.name: children
members.description: Inner content of the application

FeaturesConfig.name: FeaturesConfig

examples.description: Wrap your app in the `AppProvider` component and pass in your API key.

tabs.title: Example

examples.description: Pass in a different locale for Polaris to translate its components.

name: Admin
description:
Contains functions for authenticating and interacting with the Admin API.

This function can handle requests for apps embedded in the Admin, Admin extensions, or non-embedded apps.

definitions.title: authenticate.admin
definitions.description:
Authenticates requests coming from the Shopify admin.

The shape of the returned object changes depending on the `isEmbeddedApp` config.

AuthenticateAdmin.name: AuthenticateAdmin
AuthenticateAdmin.value:
export type AuthenticateAdmin<
  Config extends AppConfigArg,
  Resources extends ShopifyRestResources = ShopifyRestResources,
> = (request: Request) => Promise<AdminContext<Config, Resources>>;

AdminContext.name: AdminContext
AdminContext.value:
Config['isEmbeddedApp'] extends false
  ? NonEmbeddedAdminContext<Config, Resources>
  : EmbeddedAdminContext<Config, Resources>

Session.name: Session
Session.description: Stores App information from logged in merchants so they can make authenticated requests to the Admin API.

members.name: id
members.description: The unique identifier for the session.

members.name: shop
members.description: The Shopify shop domain, such as `example.myshopify.com`.

members.name: state
members.description: The state of the session. Used for the OAuth authentication code flow.

members.name: isOnline
members.description: Whether the access token in the session is online or offline.

members.name: scope
members.description: The desired scopes for the access token, at the time the session was created.

members.name: expires
members.description: The date the access token expires.

members.name: accessToken
members.description: The access token for the session.

members.name: onlineAccessInfo
members.description: Information on the user for the session. Only present for online sessions.

members.name: isActive
members.description: Whether the session is active. Active sessions have an access token that is not expired, and has the given scopes.

members.name: isScopeChanged
members.description: Whether the access token has the given scopes.

members.name: isExpired
members.description: Whether the access token is expired.

members.name: toObject
members.description: Converts an object with data into a Session.

members.name: equals
members.description: Checks whether the given session is equal to this session.

members.name: toPropertyArray
members.description: Converts the session into an array of key-value pairs.

OnlineAccessInfo.name: OnlineAccessInfo

members.name: expires_in
members.description: How long the access token is valid for, in seconds.

members.name: associated_user_scope
members.description: The effective set of scopes for the session.

members.name: associated_user
members.value: { id: number; first_name: string; last_name: string; email: string; email_verified: boolean; account_owner: boolean; locale: string; collaborator: boolean; }
members.description: The user associated with the access token.

AdminApiContext.name: AdminApiContext

members.name: rest
members.description:
Methods for interacting with the Shopify Admin REST API

There are methods for interacting with individual REST resources. You can also make `GET`, `POST`, `PUT` and `DELETE` requests should the REST resources not meet your needs.

examples.title: Using REST resources

GraphQLClient.name: GraphQLClient
GraphQLClient.value:
export type GraphQLClient<Operations extends AllOperations> = <
  Operation extends keyof Operations,
>(
  query: Operation,
  options?: GraphQLQueryOptions<Operation, Operations>,
) => Promise<
  ResponseWithType<FetchResponseBody<ReturnData<Operation, Operations>>>
>;

name: App proxy
description:
[App proxies](/docs/apps/online-store/app-proxies) take requests to Shopify links, and redirect them to external links.
The `authenticate.public.appProxy` function validates requests made to app proxies, and returns a context to enable querying Shopify APIs.

> Note: If the store has not installed the app, store-related properties such as `admin` or `storefront` will be `undefined`

JSONValue.name: JSONValue
JSONValue.value: string | number | boolean | null | JSONObject | JSONArray

members.name: length
members.description: Gets or sets the length of the array. This is a number one higher than the highest index in the array.

members.name: toString
members.description: Returns a string representation of an array.

members.name: toLocaleString
members.description: Returns a string representation of an array. The elements are converted to string using their toLocaleString methods.

members.name: pop
members.description: Removes the last element from an array and returns it. If the array is empty, undefined is returned and the array is not modified.

members.name: push
members.description: Appends new elements to the end of an array, and returns the new length of the array.

members.name: concat
members.description: Combines two or more arrays. This method returns a new array without modifying any existing arrays.

members.name: join
members.description: Adds all the elements of an array into a string, separated by the specified separator string.

members.name: reverse
members.description: Reverses the elements in an array in place. This method mutates the array and returns a reference to the same array.

members.name: shift
members.description: Removes the first element from an array and returns it. If the array is empty, undefined is returned and the array is not modified.

members.name: slice
members.description: Returns a copy of a section of an array. For both start and end, a negative index can be used to indicate an offset from the end of the array. For example, -2 refers to the second to last element of the array.

members.name: sort
members.description: Sorts an array in place. This method mutates the array and returns a reference to the same array.

members.name: splice
members.value: { (start: number, deleteCount?: number): JSONValue[]; (start: number, deleteCount: number, ...items: JSONValue[]): JSONValue[]; }
members.description: Removes elements from an array and, if necessary, inserts new elements in their place, returning the deleted elements.

members.name: unshift
members.description: Inserts new elements at the start of an array, and returns the new length of the array.

members.name: indexOf
members.description: Returns the index of the first occurrence of a value in an array, or -1 if it is not present.

members.name: lastIndexOf
members.description: Returns the index of the last occurrence of a specified value in an array, or -1 if it is not present.

members.name: every
members.value: { <S extends JSONValue>(predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => value is S, thisArg?: any): this is S[]; (predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any): boolean; }
members.description: Determines whether all the members of an array satisfy the specified test.

members.name: some
members.value: (predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any) => boolean
members.description: Determines whether the specified callback function returns true for any element of an array.

members.name: forEach
members.value: (callbackfn: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => void, thisArg?: any) => void
members.description: Performs the specified action for each element in an array.

members.name: map
members.value: <U>(callbackfn: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => U, thisArg?: any) => U[]
members.description: Calls a defined callback function on each element of an array, and returns an array that contains the results.

members.name: filter
members.value: { <S extends JSONValue>(predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => value is S, thisArg?: any): S[]; (predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any): JSONValue[]; }
members.description: Returns the elements of an array that meet the condition specified in a callback function.

members.name: reduce
members.value: { (callbackfn: (previousValue: JSONValue, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => JSONValue): JSONValue; (callbackfn: (previousValue: JSONValue, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => JSONValue, initialValue: JSONValue): JSONValue; <U>(callbackfn: (previousValue: U, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => U, initialValue: U): U; }
members.description: Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array. The return value of the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an argument in the next call to the callback function.

members.name: reduceRight
members.value: { (callbackfn: (previousValue: JSONValue, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => JSONValue): JSONValue; (callbackfn: (previousValue: JSONValue, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => JSONValue, initialValue: JSONValue): JSONValue; <U>(callbackfn: (previousValue: U, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => U, initialValue: U): U; }
members.description: Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array, in descending order. The return value of the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an argument in the next call to the callback function.

members.name: find
members.value: { <S extends JSONValue>(predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, obj: JSONValue[]) => value is S, thisArg?: any): S; (predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, obj: JSONValue[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any): JSONValue; }
members.description: Returns the value of the first element in the array where predicate is true, and undefined otherwise.

members.name: findIndex
members.value: (predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, obj: JSONValue[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any) => number
members.description: Returns the index of the first element in the array where predicate is true, and -1 otherwise.

members.name: fill
members.value: (value: JSONValue, start?: number, end?: number) => JSONArray
members.description: Changes all array elements from `start` to `end` index to a static `value` and returns the modified array

members.name: copyWithin
members.value: (target: number, start: number, end?: number) => JSONArray
members.description: Returns the this object after copying a section of the array identified by start and end to the same array starting at position target

members.name: entries
members.description: Returns an iterable of key, value pairs for every entry in the array

members.name: keys
members.description: Returns an iterable of keys in the array

members.name: values
members.description: Returns an iterable of values in the array

members.name: includes
members.description: Determines whether an array includes a certain element, returning true or false as appropriate.

members.name: flatMap
members.value: <U, This = undefined>(callback: (this: This, value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => U | readonly U[], thisArg?: This) => U[]
members.description: Calls a defined callback function on each element of an array. Then, flattens the result into a new array. This is identical to a map followed by flat with depth 1.

members.name: flat
members.value: <A, D extends number = 1>(this: A, depth?: D) => FlatArray<A, D>[]
members.description: Returns a new array with all sub-array elements concatenated into it recursively up to the specified depth.

members.name: __@iterator@175
members.description: Iterator

members.name: __@unscopables@177
members.value: { [x: number]: boolean; length?: boolean; toString?: boolean; toLocaleString?: boolean; pop?: boolean; push?: boolean; concat?: boolean; join?: boolean; reverse?: boolean; shift?: boolean; slice?: boolean; sort?: boolean; splice?: boolean; unshift?: boolean; indexOf?: boolean; lastIndexOf?: boolean; every?: boolean; some?: boolean; forEach?: boolean; map?: boolean; filter?: boolean; reduce?: boolean; reduceRight?: boolean; find?: boolean; findIndex?: boolean; fill?: boolean; copyWithin?: boolean; entries?: boolean; keys?: boolean; values?: boolean; includes?: boolean; flatMap?: boolean; flat?: boolean; [Symbol.iterator]?: boolean; readonly [Symbol.unscopables]?: boolean; at?: boolean; }
members.description: Is an object whose properties have the value 'true' when they will be absent when used in a 'with' statement.

members.name: at
members.description: Takes an integer value and returns the item at that index, allowing for positive and negative integers. Negative integers count back from the last item in the array.

name: Admin API
description:
Contains objects used to interact with the Admin API.

This object is returned as part of different contexts, such as [`admin`](/docs/api/shopify-app-remix/authenticate/admin), [`unauthenticated.admin`](/docs/api/shopify-app-remix/unauthenticated/unauthenticated-admin), and [`webhook`](/docs/api/shopify-app-remix/authenticate/webhook).

AdminApiContext.name: AdminApiContext

members.name: rest
members.description:
Methods for interacting with the Shopify Admin REST API

There are methods for interacting with individual REST resources. You can also make `GET`, `POST`, `PUT` and `DELETE` requests should the REST resources not meet your needs.

name: shopifyApp
description:
Returns a set of functions that can be used by the app's backend to be able to respond to all Shopify requests.

The shape of the returned object changes depending on the value of `distribution`. If it is `AppDistribution.ShopifyAdmin`, then only `ShopifyAppBase` objects are returned, otherwise `ShopifyAppLogin` objects are included.

AppConfigArg.name: AppConfigArg

members.name: appUrl
members.description:
The URL your app is running on.

The `@shopify/cli` provides this URL as `process.env.SHOPIFY_APP_URL`.  For development this is probably a tunnel URL that points to your local machine.  If this is a production app, this is your production URL.

members.name: sessionStorage
members.description:
An adaptor for storing sessions in your database of choice.

Shopify provides multiple session storage adaptors and you can create your own.

examples.title: Storing sessions with Prisma
examples.description: Add the `@shopify/shopify-app-session-storage-prisma` package to use the Prisma session storage.

tabs.title: Example

members.name: useOnlineTokens
members.description:
Whether your app use online or offline tokens.

If your app uses online tokens, then both online and offline tokens will be saved to your database.  This ensures your app can perform background jobs.

members.name: webhooks
members.description:
The config for the webhook topics your app would like to subscribe to.







This can be in used in conjunction with the afterAuth hook to register webhook topics when a user installs your app.  Or you can use this function in other processes such as background jobs.

examples.title: Registering for a webhook when a merchant uninstalls your app

tabs.title: /app/shopify.server.ts

members.name: hooks
members.description:
Functions to call at key places during your apps lifecycle.

These functions are called in the context of the request that triggered them.  This means you can access the session.

examples.title: Seeding your database custom data when a merchant installs your app

tabs.title: Example

members.name: isEmbeddedApp
members.description:
Does your app render embedded inside the Shopify Admin or on its own.

Unless you have very specific needs, this should be true.

members.name: distribution
members.description: How your app is distributed. Default is `AppDistribution.AppStore`.

members.name: apiVersion
members.description: What version of Shopify's Admin API's would you like to use.

tabs.title: Example

members.name: authPathPrefix
members.description:
A path that Shopify can reserve for auth related endpoints.

This must match a $ route in your Remix app.  That route must export a loader function that calls `shopify.authenticate.admin(request)`.

members.name: future

Features that will be introduced in future releases of this package.

You can opt in to these features by setting the corresponding flags. By doing so, you can prepare for future releases in advance and provide feedback on the new features.

members.name: admin
members.description:
Authenticate an admin Request and get back an authenticated admin context.  Use the authenticated admin context to interact with Shopify.

Examples of when to use this are requests from your app's UI, or requests from admin extensions.

If there is no session for the Request, this will redirect the merchant to correct auth flows.

members.name: flow
members.description:
Authenticate a Flow extension Request and get back an authenticated context, containing an admin context to access the API, and the payload of the request.

If there is no session for the Request, this will return an HTTP 400 error.

Note that this will always be a POST request.

AuthenticatePublicLegacy.name: AuthenticatePublicLegacy
AuthenticatePublicLegacy.description:
Methods for authenticating Requests from Shopify's public surfaces

To maintain backwards compatability this is a function and an object.

Do not use `authenticate.public()`. Use `authenticate.public.checkout()` instead. `authenticate.public()` will be removed in v2.

Methods are:

- `authenticate.public.checkout()` for authenticating requests from checkout extensions - `authenticate.public.appProxy()` for authenticating requests from app proxies

JSONValue.name: JSONValue
JSONValue.value: string | number | boolean | null | JSONObject | JSONArray

members.name: length
members.description: Gets or sets the length of the array. This is a number one higher than the highest index in the array.

members.name: toString
members.description: Returns a string representation of an array.

members.name: toLocaleString
members.description: Returns a string representation of an array. The elements are converted to string using their toLocaleString methods.

members.name: pop
members.description: Removes the last element from an array and returns it. If the array is empty, undefined is returned and the array is not modified.

members.name: push
members.description: Appends new elements to the end of an array, and returns the new length of the array.

members.name: concat
members.description: Combines two or more arrays. This method returns a new array without modifying any existing arrays.

members.name: join
members.description: Adds all the elements of an array into a string, separated by the specified separator string.

members.name: reverse
members.description: Reverses the elements in an array in place. This method mutates the array and returns a reference to the same array.

members.name: shift
members.description: Removes the first element from an array and returns it. If the array is empty, undefined is returned and the array is not modified.

members.name: slice
members.description: Returns a copy of a section of an array. For both start and end, a negative index can be used to indicate an offset from the end of the array. For example, -2 refers to the second to last element of the array.

members.name: sort
members.description: Sorts an array in place. This method mutates the array and returns a reference to the same array.

members.name: splice
members.value: { (start: number, deleteCount?: number): JSONValue[]; (start: number, deleteCount: number, ...items: JSONValue[]): JSONValue[]; }
members.description: Removes elements from an array and, if necessary, inserts new elements in their place, returning the deleted elements.

members.name: unshift
members.description: Inserts new elements at the start of an array, and returns the new length of the array.

members.name: indexOf
members.description: Returns the index of the first occurrence of a value in an array, or -1 if it is not present.

members.name: lastIndexOf
members.description: Returns the index of the last occurrence of a specified value in an array, or -1 if it is not present.

members.name: every
members.value: { <S extends JSONValue>(predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => value is S, thisArg?: any): this is S[]; (predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any): boolean; }
members.description: Determines whether all the members of an array satisfy the specified test.

members.name: some
members.value: (predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any) => boolean
members.description: Determines whether the specified callback function returns true for any element of an array.

members.name: forEach
members.value: (callbackfn: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => void, thisArg?: any) => void
members.description: Performs the specified action for each element in an array.

members.name: map
members.value: <U>(callbackfn: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => U, thisArg?: any) => U[]
members.description: Calls a defined callback function on each element of an array, and returns an array that contains the results.

members.name: filter
members.value: { <S extends JSONValue>(predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => value is S, thisArg?: any): S[]; (predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any): JSONValue[]; }
members.description: Returns the elements of an array that meet the condition specified in a callback function.

members.name: reduce
members.value: { (callbackfn: (previousValue: JSONValue, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => JSONValue): JSONValue; (callbackfn: (previousValue: JSONValue, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => JSONValue, initialValue: JSONValue): JSONValue; <U>(callbackfn: (previousValue: U, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => U, initialValue: U): U; }
members.description: Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array. The return value of the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an argument in the next call to the callback function.

members.name: reduceRight
members.value: { (callbackfn: (previousValue: JSONValue, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => JSONValue): JSONValue; (callbackfn: (previousValue: JSONValue, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => JSONValue, initialValue: JSONValue): JSONValue; <U>(callbackfn: (previousValue: U, currentValue: JSONValue, currentIndex: number, array: JSONValue[]) => U, initialValue: U): U; }
members.description: Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array, in descending order. The return value of the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an argument in the next call to the callback function.

members.name: find
members.value: { <S extends JSONValue>(predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, obj: JSONValue[]) => value is S, thisArg?: any): S; (predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, obj: JSONValue[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any): JSONValue; }
members.description: Returns the value of the first element in the array where predicate is true, and undefined otherwise.

members.name: findIndex
members.value: (predicate: (value: JSONValue, index: number, obj: JSONValue[]) => unknown, thisArg?: any) => number
members.description: Returns the index of the first element in the array where predicate is true, and -1 otherwise.

members.name: fill
members.value: (value: JSONValue, start?: number, end?: number) => JSONArray
members.description: Changes all array elements from `start` to `end` index to a static `value` and returns the modified array

members.name: copyWithin
members.value: (target: number, start: number, end?: number) => JSONArray
members.description: Returns the this object after copying a section of the array identified by start and end to the same array starting at position target

members.name: entries
members.description: Returns an iterable of key, value pairs for every entry in the array

members.name: keys
members.description: Returns an iterable of keys in the array

members.name: values
members.description: Returns an iterable of values in the array

members.name: includes
members.description: Determines whether an array includes a certain element, returning true or false as appropriate.

members.name: flatMap
members.value: <U, This = undefined>(callback: (this: This, value: JSONValue, index: number, array: JSONValue[]) => U | readonly U[], thisArg?: This) => U[]
members.description: Calls a defined callback function on each element of an array. Then, flattens the result into a new array. This is identical to a map followed by flat with depth 1.

members.name: flat
members.value: <A, D extends number = 1>(this: A, depth?: D) => FlatArray<A, D>[]
members.description: Returns a new array with all sub-array elements concatenated into it recursively up to the specified depth.

members.name: __@iterator@175
members.description: Iterator

members.name: __@unscopables@177
members.value: { [x: number]: boolean; length?: boolean; toString?: boolean; toLocaleString?: boolean; pop?: boolean; push?: boolean; concat?: boolean; join?: boolean; reverse?: boolean; shift?: boolean; slice?: boolean; sort?: boolean; splice?: boolean; unshift?: boolean; indexOf?: boolean; lastIndexOf?: boolean; every?: boolean; some?: boolean; forEach?: boolean; map?: boolean; filter?: boolean; reduce?: boolean; reduceRight?: boolean; find?: boolean; findIndex?: boolean; fill?: boolean; copyWithin?: boolean; entries?: boolean; keys?: boolean; values?: boolean; includes?: boolean; flatMap?: boolean; flat?: boolean; [Symbol.iterator]?: boolean; readonly [Symbol.unscopables]?: boolean; at?: boolean; }
members.description: Is an object whose properties have the value 'true' when they will be absent when used in a 'with' statement.

members.name: at
members.description: Takes an integer value and returns the item at that index, allowing for positive and negative integers. Negative integers count back from the last item in the array.

This function won't be present when the `distribution` config option is set to `AppDistribution.ShopifyAdmin`, because Admin apps aren't allowed to show a login page.

name: Unauthenticated admin
description:
Allows interacting with the Admin API when working outside of Shopify requests.
This enables apps to integrate with 3rd party services and perform background tasks.

> Caution:
> This function doesn't perform **any** validation and shouldn't rely on raw user input.

When using this function, consider the following:

#### Background tasks

Apps should ensure that the shop domain is authenticated when enqueueing jobs.

#### 3rd party service requests

Apps must obtain the shop domain from the 3rd party service in a secure way.

members.name: id
members.description: The unique identifier for the session.

members.name: shop
members.description: The Shopify shop domain, such as `example.myshopify.com`.

members.name: state
members.description: The state of the session. Used for the OAuth authentication code flow.

members.name: isOnline
members.description: Whether the access token in the session is online or offline.

members.name: scope
members.description: The desired scopes for the access token, at the time the session was created.

members.name: expires
members.description: The date the access token expires.

members.name: accessToken
members.description: The access token for the session.

members.name: onlineAccessInfo
members.description: Information on the user for the session. Only present for online sessions.

members.name: isActive
members.description: Whether the session is active. Active sessions have an access token that is not expired, and has the given scopes.

members.name: isScopeChanged
members.description: Whether the access token has the given scopes.

members.name: isExpired
members.description: Whether the access token is expired.

members.name: toObject
members.description: Converts an object with data into a Session.

members.name: equals
members.description: Checks whether the given session is equal to this session.

members.name: toPropertyArray
members.description: Converts the session into an array of key-value pairs.
